[{'created': '2019-02-07 19:12:10.000000000', 'message': 'fix: data access when having non-zero metadata size

The function get_data_ptr_from_fragment() actually returns a pointer
to the metadata header. In most of the code it is the expected behavior but in
fragments_to_string() we want the actual content without the metadata.
Creation of a new function prefixed by _ to address this particular case.

Change-Id: I2afa68dcaf9b805f1653ff281623dc72df098a64
'}]
commit_message:
fix: data access when having non-zero metadata size

The function get_data_ptr_from_fragment() actually returns a pointer
to the metadata header. In most of the code it is the expected behavior but in
fragments_to_string() we want the actual content without the metadata.
Creation of a new function prefixed by _ to address this particular case.

Change-Id: I2afa68dcaf9b805f1653ff281623dc72df098a64

I don't understand the other question."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-27 14:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> I don't understand the other question.

I just would like to clarify there is something to be cleanup when ByteIO is used.
The commit message says that "data" to be uploaded can be ByteIO instead of a file.
In case of a file, we delete a temporary file.
In case of ByteIO, is no temporary file created? Is there nothing to be clean up?'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-01-27 16:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> In case of ByteIO, is no temporary file created? Is there nothing to be clean up?

BytesIO is an in-memory file-like object. It will be cleaned up by the garbage collector as soon as nothing refers to it anymore (in this case, when the request is finished processing).'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-29 04:53:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Thanks for clarification. I haven't understood when this situation happens so I asked the detail. Looks good to me now."}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-01-29 13:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-01-29 13:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Do we need to report a bug for this?'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-01-29 14:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Yes, we do, I will do it shortly, sorry for the delay.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-03-09 14:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-03-10 00:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-10 20:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-10 21:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Catch AttributeError when deleting temp file on image upload

When the image upload finishes, we try to delete the temporary
file that was used for the upload. However, depending on how
Horizon is deployed, instead of a file it can be a BytesIO
instance, which leads to an AttributeError. This happens in
a separate thread, so Horizon itself doesn't crash, but it's
better to catch that exception.

Change-Id: Iaa66d9c87060c1e001f3f6e31f630d6092df55d3
Closes-Bug: #1866632

commit_message:
Add mapping for python-dev for Ubuntu Focal

In Ubuntu Focal there is no package named 'python-dev'.
This patch maps this to 'python3-dev'.

Change-Id: I2ea41c36d13748dd5a375853b26aacfc63c1bd48
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas.florath@telekom.de>
Closes-Bug: 1865328

thanks Alex,

my only comment is, there isn't anything ceph related in this image though, can we name it overcloud-minimal vs the default overcloud-full image?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-05 14:02:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

it's ceph specific because i think we don't include things necessary for normal overcloud nodes.  I'll try out an overcloud deploy with a minimal and see if it works for like a compute node"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-05 21:40:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Workflow

So this is ceph specific because it doesn't have ovs or any of the ipa/certmonger bits that would be required for any other services."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-03-06 09:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> So this is ceph specific because it doesn't have ovs or any of the
 > ipa/certmonger bits that would be required for any other services.

ovs shouldn't be necessary because networking can be configured using linux bridge (which is what would happen for the ceph storage nodes)

ipa/certmonger is necessary to configure openstack services with ssl though; I was hoping we could get these base/extra centos repos but maybe it's not the case

I don't want to slow this down, was leaving some comments hoping to make the idea of a "minimal" image more general, "one which doesn't need openstack packages installed and can be deployed via ooo" vs anything ceph specific'}, {'account_id': 23215, 'date': '2020-03-06 10:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-06 14:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

we can add the certmonger stuff back but I believe the target for this is a ceph only standalone role'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-10 16:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-10 21:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit d666cd71df3d83b792f71cc6944077685fa91278'}]

commit_message:
Add overcloud-ceph image build yaml

Added image yaml config files to build an overcloud-ceph image that does
not have the HA, openvswitch or openstack client related packages
installed by default. This image is useful for dedicated ceph nodes that
do not have any openstack related services on them.

Change-Id: I4e14a49c428b8b7530f49218b413c795e777851b

[{'created': '2020-03-06 17:08:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix hypervisors paginted collection_name.

Hypervisor view builder's _collection_name,
'hypervisors' is used to build next link that
sdk use as uri to do paginated query. But correct
API should be `GET /v2.1/os-hypervisors?<params>`
rather than `GET /v2.1/hypervisors?<params>`.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idc4f3fe54136a6bd3dbc7dc0efd3f62745991199
Closes-Bug: 1864428
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
(cherry picked from commit b68033ecc9d38dcbe339c993338bdca691f73b33)
(cherry picked from commit 2f4e3ac3b018128b11a80ec343b333c3a6e4703f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix hypervisors paginted collection_name.

Hypervisor view builder's _collection_name,
'hypervisors' is used to build next link that
sdk use as uri to do paginated query. But correct
API should be `GET /v2.1/os-hypervisors?<params>`
rather than `GET /v2.1/hypervisors?<params>`.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idc4f3fe54136a6bd3dbc7dc0efd3f62745991199
Closes-Bug: 1864428
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
(cherry picked from commit b68033ecc9d38dcbe339c993338bdca691f73b33)
(cherry picked from commit 2f4e3ac3b018128b11a80ec343b333c3a6e4703f)

commit_message:
Add posibilities to configure replication_probe_interval

Add posibilities to configure replication_probe_interval for ovsdb-server
by OVNDBSReplicationInterval.
It configure probe interval for connection for ovsdb-server when it is
in backup mode and connects to the active ovsdb-server for replication

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710424/
Change-Id: I94f66ebe5970305a613e8741c00d8fdbc1cc161f

messages:
[{'account_id': 31670, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-03-10 10:28:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-10 15:51:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-10 21:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-10 10:28:33.000000000', 'message': 'Make pacemaker_resource serializable

Change the internal storage of resource operations from a Set to an
Array of Hashes. This prevents an error when a Puppet Agent tries to
serialize the data to its transaction store and fails to re-read it
with:

Error: Transaction store file
/opt/puppetlabs/puppet/cache/state/transactionstore.yaml is corrupt
((/opt/puppetlabs/puppet/cache/state/transactionstore.yaml): Tried to
load unspecified class: Set); replacing

To support the change, the handling of operations is generally stricter,
preferring to raise an error on unexpected input instead of silently
dropping invalid entries or attempting to convert them.

Change-Id: I4bee307c81d606981574cd0004150f6f3f31f81e
'}]
commit_message:
Make pacemaker_resource serializable

Change the internal storage of resource operations from a Set to an
Array of Hashes. This prevents an error when a Puppet Agent tries to
serialize the data to its transaction store and fails to re-read it
with:

Error: Transaction store file
/opt/puppetlabs/puppet/cache/state/transactionstore.yaml is corrupt
((/opt/puppetlabs/puppet/cache/state/transactionstore.yaml): Tried to
load unspecified class: Set); replacing

To support the change, the handling of operations is generally stricter,
preferring to raise an error on unexpected input instead of silently
dropping invalid entries or attempting to convert them.

Change-Id: I4bee307c81d606981574cd0004150f6f3f31f81e

Some time ago in patch [1] deprecated option
'gateway_external_network_id' was removed.

commit_message:
Remove leftovers of get_external_network_id for router

Some time ago in patch [1] deprecated option
'gateway_external_network_id' was removed.
After that commit [2] removed rpc function "get_external_network_id"
but there still left some leftovers from this.
This patch removes them completly.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666409/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682418/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/710429

Change-Id: Ie58ea7f021db051b68be80a1d98f5985ff19fe23

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-10 12:25:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix glance policy.json deployment

Glance has dropped default policy.json [1] which
was used by "smart sources". We are fixing this by setting content
to empty dict, that way the only content deployed will be the one
provided by overrides, so that won't change current behaviour.
Additionally `glance_policy_content` has been introduced, which
eventually is going to replace `glance_policy_overrides` in the future.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/dd1975bd3ef690d8bf1272923f0eac7beab48c6d

Change-Id: I3f365684542b390ea02c08ab56f76a447f65a814
'}, {'created': '2020-03-10 12:27:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix glance policy.json deployment

Glance has dropped default policy.json [1] which
was used by "smart sources". We are fixing this by setting content
to empty dict, that way the only content deployed will be the one
provided by overrides, so that won't change current behaviour.
Additionally `glance_policy_content` has been introduced, which
eventually is going to replace `glance_policy_overrides` in the future.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/dd1975bd3ef690d8bf1272923f0eac7beab48c6d

Change-Id: I3f365684542b390ea02c08ab56f76a447f65a814
'}]
commit_message:
Fix glance policy.json deployment

Glance has dropped default policy.json [1] which
was used by "smart sources". We are fixing this by setting content
to empty dict, that way the only content deployed will be the one
provided by overrides, so that won't change current behaviour.
Additionally `glance_policy_content` has been introduced, which
eventually is going to replace `glance_policy_overrides` in the future.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/dd1975bd3ef690d8bf1272923f0eac7beab48c6d

Change-Id: I3f365684542b390ea02c08ab56f76a447f65a814

commit_message:
Kerberos patch to enable authentication

Kerberos authentication via keystone and keystone-ldap.
This requires a new relation and new attributes to
connect to this back-end. This change is also linked to
a change in keystone-ldap charm and
interface-keystone-domain-backend charm.

Charm Spec: https://docs.google.com/document/d/10VoNIDmAGEB-GQrKZBxWTt4qjZzWaIhMDWXYueK8wVQ/
Change-Id: Id0e26a3ae849fadaa2c656d5e8b58fe66b97ef39

subject: Switch networking-baremetal to cycle-with-rc
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-25 22:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-28 11:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

The rationale behind these changes make sense.

LGTM only +1 for now by waiting for PLT/liaison/team approval.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-09 17:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

While we have not made an intermediate release this cycle, we would like to reserve the right to do so in the future if we choose. If we switch to cycle-with-rc will it prevent switching back to cycle-with-intermediate in order to produce an intermediate release in the future?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-09 17:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> While we have not made an intermediate release this cycle, we would
 > like to reserve the right to do so in the future if we choose. If
 > we switch to cycle-with-rc will it prevent switching back to
 > cycle-with-intermediate in order to produce an intermediate release
 > in the future?

It is possible to switch each cycle. But maybe another question - does it make more sense for this deliverable to be classified as "independent", meaning it isn't necessarily tied to a given development cycle and is only released if and when there is something to be released.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-03-09 17:39:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's tied to both ironic and neutron cycles, so I'm afraid it wouldn't work."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-09 18:11:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK, let's leave as cycle-with-intermediary for now. If it ends up that this project continues to have such low activity that there is only one release needed per cycle, we can re-evaluate then if it makes more sense to just do the -rc model.

Will wait for any feedback before I abandon this."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-10 20:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 22:02:17.000000000', 'message': 'Switch networking-baremetal to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
networking-baremetal only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I784247d5dcb10173ab3fbcd2e4fa9f292b82f566
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch networking-baremetal to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
networking-baremetal only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I784247d5dcb10173ab3fbcd2e4fa9f292b82f566
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support for stateless security groups

Add support for stateful attribute of security groups,
allowing a user to create security groups with stateful
false.

Change-Id: I380b2ab0fa4f81f676711d97138c6097c4790cd7
Blueprint: stateless-security-groups

commit_message:
Remove duplicated topic parts from default value

Ceilometer is adding the topic prefix and suffix automatically, which makes the resulting
topic have the 'ceilometer/' prefix and '.sample' suffix duplicated.

This patch also adds comment to ceilometer env to ensure user deploys Redis for coordination.

Change-Id: I26027cd9b9eb1d166eae52021b1aef9d82a975f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-10 13:39:46.000000000', 'message': "build-images: deal with different package name for PyYAML

Package name for PyYAML is different on centos8 than on centos7.
On CentOS7, it's now PyYAML:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/PyYAML-3.10-11.el7.x86_64.rpm

On CentOS8, it's python3-pyyaml:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8/BaseOS/x86_64/os/Packages/python3-pyyaml-3.12-12.el8.x86_64.rpm

So this patch updates pre.yaml to install the right rpms using the
python_v variable to figure out which rpm is needed.

Change-Id: I27076f0afbe27c1d02f59c1fd9eafda2d642bbd5
Closes-Bug: #1866843
"}]
commit_message:
build-images: deal with different package name for PyYAML

Package name for PyYAML is different on centos8 than on centos7.
On CentOS7, it's now PyYAML:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/PyYAML-3.10-11.el7.x86_64.rpm

On CentOS8, it's python3-pyyaml:
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8/BaseOS/x86_64/os/Packages/python3-pyyaml-3.12-12.el8.x86_64.rpm

So this patch updates pre.yaml to install the right rpms using the
python_v variable to figure out which rpm is needed.

Change-Id: I27076f0afbe27c1d02f59c1fd9eafda2d642bbd5
Closes-Bug: #1866843

[Community goal] Add contributor and PTL guide

This patch also changes CONTRIBUTING.rst file in root directory
of the repo to fit with new cookiecutter template proposed in
the community goal description.

Change-Id: I190afcff68c4a20f42aec34cb299bd862e7c7efd
Story: #2007236
Task: #38540

commit_message:
ChunkedBackupDriver: Freeing memory on restore

When restoring many backups, the backup service uses a lot of memory and
when we do many concurrent restores the backup service ends up getting
killed becase the system runs out of memory.

This patch reduces the ref count to the data as soon as possible to let
Python garbage collect it instead of hogging it for the whole chunk
restore.

Related-Bug: #1865011
Change-Id: I942d9d8b3976232ae1cf82b698fb27285fbef13a
(cherry picked from commit 69462315bc8416bd02ebd6085f0cfc141cfd8877)

commit_message:
Remove discover_nodes workflows

This change removes the discover_nodes workflows. These workflows have been
converted to direct calls from tripleoclient and are no longer needed.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38450

Depends-On: Ic13a3f70383afdc23abd29b8db230f01e0bebf55
Change-Id: I1628eb2d4dc2887915eb7e56572b3bc5a9a0045f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-04 09:18:29.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure bootable volume is gone in scenario test before tearDown

In test_create_server_from_volume_snapshot tearDown would trigger
bootable volume and snapshot deletion in the correct order but not
wait for the bootable volume to be deleted, causing snapshot
deletion to fail.

This change makes the scenario test explicitly delete the bootable
volume to avoid the race condition in tearDown.

Change-Id: I3fe2ce349ce629bfc96f6ddfb45b22687a1be137
Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1863750
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure bootable volume is gone in scenario test before tearDown

In test_create_server_from_volume_snapshot tearDown would trigger
bootable volume and snapshot deletion in the correct order but not
wait for the bootable volume to be deleted, causing snapshot
deletion to fail.

This change makes the scenario test explicitly delete the bootable
volume to avoid the race condition in tearDown.

Change-Id: I3fe2ce349ce629bfc96f6ddfb45b22687a1be137
Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1863750

commit_message:
Migrate molecule jobs from centos 7 to 8

- assure we have docker installed
- fixed hiera call, which can be in /usr/bin/hiera,
  /opt/puppetlabs/bin/hiera, or /bin/hiera

Change-Id: I20cbcdead152ccad81fc18f5cf1af9520268a173
Co-authored-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add new Validation Framework projects

Create two repositories for the Validation Framework:
- validations-libs
- validations-common

This is a first, needed step in order to get proper separation for the
code and libraries.
The tripleo-validations repository stay as is for now.

Needed-By: I545338f21b0ef308f524e585c44801eab8d3cac6
Change-Id: I149801b88484258fa05dabd1bc6a471462199e4c

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-02-26 19:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I see in scenario001 job that the even publisher is configured  

      publishers:
          - gnocchi://?archive_policy=ceilometer-high-rate
          - panko://
          - notifier://192.168.24.1:5666/?driver=amqp&topic=ceilometer/event.sample

https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_d87/707135/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/d879841/logs/undercloud/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/ceilometer/etc/ceilometer/event_pipeline.yaml

But in the ceilometer agent logs i see this traceback:

topic=ceilometer/event.sample.sample> failed: timed out
2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging Traceback (most recent call last):
2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_messaging/notify/messaging.py", line 69, in notify
2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging     retry=retry)

2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging     return func(self, *args, **kws)
2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_amqp1.py", line 397, in send_notification
2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging     raise rc

2020-02-12 16:18:59.240 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging 
2020-02-12 16:18:59.285 33 ERROR oslo_messaging.notify.messaging [-] Could not send notification to ceilometer/event.sample. Payload={'priority': 'SAMPLE', 'event_type': 'event', 'timestamp': u'2020-02-12 16:18:28.801819', 'publisher_id': 'telemetry.publisher.standalone.localdomain', 'payload': [{'event_type': u'identity.endpoint.created', 'traits': [('service', 1, u'identity.standalone.localdomain'), ('resource_id', 1, u'5ecb14c4821046afaa7d9d4ce6cde1f1')], 'message_signature': '49245f52ec4da18bd91fac4a6e0b8f2a719c08097fb352d2df35442b1b0b6d2e', 'raw': {}, 'generated': '2020-02-12T16:14:45.278507', 'message_id': u'ca329a06-43af-41ee-bb1f-fb9fc3494fe6'}], 'message_id': u'c44a4f02-00f0-4c2c-b616-4362c1dec0c1'}: MessageDeliveryFailure: Notify message sent to <Target topic=ceilometer/event.sample.sample> failed: timed out'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-02-26 19:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-02-28 21:45:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

After extensive testing my Paul and Leif, the issue with these errors is because nothing is consuming them off the bus and they times out due to no ack. They dont settle apparently. Once we started up a Smart Gateway to grab the data of the bus no errors were found in the logs. Since there is no SG in CI, i guess we can ignore these errors. Removing my -1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-02 13:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-03-04 16:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-03-09 09:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Enable configuration of notifier publishers

This patch:
  - moves Ceilometer notification agent to proper composable service
  - Adds possibility to configure query parameters for notifier publishers

Change-Id: Ieb3d97c3e2c3190607902227980e1ef4a1de2c8e
Depends-On: I5cd0b6e99f5ffcc495225c61f0773240d90e7930
(cherry picked from commit b2162a2e4526448d43f07fc31485cfb4c30e86c1)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

os-testr is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Switch to using sphinx-build, remove cruft from setup.cfg, setup.py,
tox.ini, conf.py.
Update hacking version to support python3 properly.
Fix problems found by pep8.

Change-Id: I6ab22dda05132a735bd9e5caf16cc2bd172b06cc

commit_message:
Fix aggregate functional test for id restriction

Nova just landed a change that validates aggregate ids are ints.
This had a side-effect of causing our aggregate test to fail,
because we were sending a delete by name not id. It was failing
open for us - the delete would have likely not done anything
before.

Change-Id: I1e151454f39d51db52cdc7a23dbdcbf9b28c9381

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 14:44:15.000000000', 'message': 'Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

Conflicts:
    common/deploy-steps-tasks-step-0.j2.yaml
    common/deploy-steps.j2

Change-Id: I2db81d39b3294aa2784a340562f10fd9bf3fe9ee
(cherry picked from commit 6f8b2db26a9b3d605b60a539e2e0c4333cbb12b4)
(cherry picked from commit f19e2c71445462335a26a2881de8d3f7fb3d74ec)
'}]
commit_message:
Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

Conflicts:
    common/deploy-steps-tasks-step-0.j2.yaml
    common/deploy-steps.j2

Change-Id: I2db81d39b3294aa2784a340562f10fd9bf3fe9ee
(cherry picked from commit 6f8b2db26a9b3d605b60a539e2e0c4333cbb12b4)
(cherry picked from commit f19e2c71445462335a26a2881de8d3f7fb3d74ec)

commit_message:
Ensure container_startup_configs_json_stat is defined

When using --tags to run only a subset of tasks from
common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml, the condition that checks the result of
container_startup_configs_json_stat.stat.exists was failing since the
task that defined it was skipped.

This patch adds an additional "is defined" check to ensure the var is
defined be the result is checked.

Change-Id: Iadde90ed9416902848df2e60551470c0f1689a32
(cherry picked from commit 7bd3bbbd0691020538694c3bc5e5b97c16d19b10)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 13:32:10.000000000', 'message': 'Use async tasks for long running common tasks

Use async with poll: 0 for the long running common tasks including:

- puppet host configuration
- container-puppet generate config
- container starting
- container-puppet bootstrap tasks

Executing the tasks in this manner and then polling for the results
causes all of the tasks to be started in parallel across all the nodes,
regardless of the number of ansible forks configured.

The behavior will be that ansible will start the task on the first count
of nodes that matches the configured forks value. Since poll:0, ansible
will immediately move on to the next batch, etc. Effectively, all the
tasks are started in parallel just as quickly as ansible can start them.

The polling tasks (async_status) will then execute in parallel up to the
configured number of forks. As tasks start to finish, ansible moves on
to checking the status of the next batch (again, up to the configured
number of forks). Since most nodes will configure around the same time,
the polling tasks finish roughly at the same time (except for
differences in roles, such as controllers taking much longer).

This behavior results in a signifcant performance improvement at scale,
or when deploying any number of nodes greater than the configured forks
value. Instead of waiting for the first batch to fully complete, all the
nodes are started in parallel.

For example, if puppet host configuration usually takes 5 minutes per
node, and there are 100 nodes, with 25 forks, previously this would have
taken 20 minutes. With this patch, it would now take closer to 5 minutes
for all 100 nodes, plus some overhead for polling.

This more closely matches the behavior previously used with Heat, when
all the nodes were operating in "pull" mode in parallel.

Change-Id: I0c651d127cd2bb179f7592a0519a5fd5064faeb3
(cherry picked from commit 106ce3267fd1471cee184f697f7cb19c695ab36c)
(cherry picked from commit 7362626cabf4f6b77cb16c147f227d506974b64a)
'}, {'created': '2020-01-29 14:03:36.000000000', 'message': 'Use async tasks for long running common tasks

- puppet host configuration
- container-puppet generate config
- container starting

regardless of the number of ansible forks configured.

The behavior will be that ansible will start the task on the first count
of nodes that matches the configured forks value. Since poll:0, ansible
will immediately move on to the next batch, etc. Effectively, all the
tasks are started in parallel just as quickly as ansible can start them.

The polling tasks (async_status) will then execute in parallel up to the
configured number of forks. As tasks start to finish, ansible moves on
to checking the status of the next batch (again, up to the configured
number of forks). Since most nodes will configure around the same time,
the polling tasks finish roughly at the same time (except for
differences in roles, such as controllers taking much longer).

This behavior results in a signifcant performance improvement at scale,
or when deploying any number of nodes greater than the configured forks
value. Instead of waiting for the first batch to fully complete, all the
nodes are started in parallel.

For example, if puppet host configuration usually takes 5 minutes per
node, and there are 100 nodes, with 25 forks, previously this would have
taken 20 minutes. With this patch, it would now take closer to 5 minutes
for all 100 nodes, plus some overhead for polling.

This more closely matches the behavior previously used with Heat, when
all the nodes were operating in "pull" mode in parallel.

Change-Id: I0c651d127cd2bb179f7592a0519a5fd5064faeb3
(cherry picked from commit 106ce3267fd1471cee184f697f7cb19c695ab36c)
(cherry picked from commit 7362626cabf4f6b77cb16c147f227d506974b64a)
(cherry picked from commit cdc40e9f705a294bcf44414d5c2dddf9fa20983f)
'}]
commit_message:
Use async tasks for long running common tasks

Use async with poll: 0 for the long running common tasks including:

- puppet host configuration
- container-puppet generate config
- container starting
- container-puppet bootstrap tasks

Executing the tasks in this manner and then polling for the results
causes all of the tasks to be started in parallel across all the nodes,
regardless of the number of ansible forks configured.

The behavior will be that ansible will start the task on the first count
of nodes that matches the configured forks value. Since poll:0, ansible
will immediately move on to the next batch, etc. Effectively, all the
tasks are started in parallel just as quickly as ansible can start them.

The polling tasks (async_status) will then execute in parallel up to the
configured number of forks. As tasks start to finish, ansible moves on
to checking the status of the next batch (again, up to the configured
number of forks). Since most nodes will configure around the same time,
the polling tasks finish roughly at the same time (except for
differences in roles, such as controllers taking much longer).

This behavior results in a signifcant performance improvement at scale,
or when deploying any number of nodes greater than the configured forks
value. Instead of waiting for the first batch to fully complete, all the
nodes are started in parallel.

For example, if puppet host configuration usually takes 5 minutes per
node, and there are 100 nodes, with 25 forks, previously this would have
taken 20 minutes. With this patch, it would now take closer to 5 minutes
for all 100 nodes, plus some overhead for polling.

This more closely matches the behavior previously used with Heat, when
all the nodes were operating in "pull" mode in parallel.

Change-Id: I0c651d127cd2bb179f7592a0519a5fd5064faeb3
(cherry picked from commit 106ce3267fd1471cee184f697f7cb19c695ab36c)
(cherry picked from commit 7362626cabf4f6b77cb16c147f227d506974b64a)
(cherry picked from commit cdc40e9f705a294bcf44414d5c2dddf9fa20983f)

commit_message:
Use pipefail instead of checking PIPESTATUS

It seems that the pipefail option works more reliably than
$PIPESTATUS. The former also provides an established pattern for
the shell commands executed via ansible in tripleo.

Closes-bug: #1836596

Change-Id: Ic70a11281b471a51698490bd899c99dafaba1e35
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7f2e8b875ae566ce3b6e0c7090d56300b1c55b16)

commit_message:
Execute deploy_steps_tasks per step

Instead of including the entire deploy_steps_tasks.yaml tasks file for
each role at each step, use the per-step files and only if they exist.

This cuts down on the amount of time that ansible has to spend skipping
tasks that don't get run at a certain step, which can be significant at
scale.

Change-Id: I06ee04b9b47226433f25e3cff08c461462a907d9
(cherry picked from commit 2a6336a742c05e2e6c5fd30a21cd1989823773a1)
(cherry picked from commit 829cefa761ec12016bc11636f3aeb501485a4df9)

commit_message:
Move some common tasks to step 1

These tasks in deploy-steps-tasks.yaml currently run at every step, but
they only actually need to run once. This patch moves them to
deploy-steps-tasks-step-1.yaml so that they are only run at step1 and do
not need to be skipped at every later step.

Change-Id: Ib64d1969c5dff3901829583fc2db2f6e2a3acbb3
(cherry picked from commit af88862d9b27657160c47c9bab249af246af76f8)
(cherry picked from commit 4b6eb4ca9fedfc84411f577370b287c9296427c5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 12:50:24.000000000', 'message': 'Check for correct file during --skip-deploy-identifier handling.

At some point, the file names that are checked for existence when
determining to apply the logic for --skip-deploy-identifier must have
changed.

Since the file check was not updated, it was checking for a file that
would never exist, and so the ansible tasks were always run (or re-run).

Effectively, --skip-deploy-identifier was broken and it had no effect.

This patch updates the file check to use the correct name, and also
checks the right file per step. It only applies to Train since on
master, these files were switched to write out per container files in a
directory, and the fix was addressed at that time.

Change-Id: Ia01a10c488d22e38cd86b0117e9c048ea5cc3298
Closes-Bug: #1860566
(cherry picked from commit b1ac5e1e2bd793774657f0e2e67721f8218dc92b)

commit_message:
Check for correct file during --skip-deploy-identifier handling.

At some point, the file names that are checked for existence when
determining to apply the logic for --skip-deploy-identifier must have
changed.

Since the file check was not updated, it was checking for a file that
would never exist, and so the ansible tasks were always run (or re-run).

Effectively, --skip-deploy-identifier was broken and it had no effect.

This patch updates the file check to use the correct name, and also
checks the right file per step. It only applies to Train since on
master, these files were switched to write out per container files in a
directory, and the fix was addressed at that time.

Change-Id: Ia01a10c488d22e38cd86b0117e9c048ea5cc3298
Closes-Bug: #1860566
(cherry picked from commit b1ac5e1e2bd793774657f0e2e67721f8218dc92b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 12:50:24.000000000', 'message': 'Move common step 1 tasks to their own file

The large block of tasks in deploy-steps-tasks.yaml that are run only at
step 1, results in a large number of tasks being skipped at steps 2-5.
Task skipping is not "free", as ansible has to repeatedly compute what
needs to be skipped.

Note that the previous usage with the block statement causes the "when"
statement to be inherited to each task, so it has to be recalculated for
every task across every node for all steps.

The issue starts to become apparent with deployments with larger number
of nodes.

This commit refactors the steps 1 tasks into their own tasks file, and
then uses the include_task module to only include the tasks at step 1.

A separate play is also used for these step 1 tasks so that ansible
doesn't have to repeatedly calculate if the include_task should be
executed for steps 2-5 as well.

Backport note:
This is a re-implementation rather than a clean cherry-pick due to other
changes in this branch which make a clean cherry-pick impossible. The
contents of deploy-steps-tasks-step-1.yaml are a move of tasks from
deploy-steps-tasks.yaml as was done in the original patch. The rest of
the patch is the same.

Change-Id: Id5985ce8ac741baa9adc9f5874df0459fd4c24b2
'}, {'created': '2020-01-29 14:03:36.000000000', 'message': 'Move common step 1 tasks to their own file

The large block of tasks in deploy-steps-tasks.yaml that are run only at
step 1, results in a large number of tasks being skipped at steps 2-5.
Task skipping is not "free", as ansible has to repeatedly compute what
needs to be skipped.

Note that the previous usage with the block statement causes the "when"
statement to be inherited to each task, so it has to be recalculated for
every task across every node for all steps.

The issue starts to become apparent with deployments with larger number
of nodes.

This commit refactors the steps 1 tasks into their own tasks file, and
then uses the include_task module to only include the tasks at step 1.

A separate play is also used for these step 1 tasks so that ansible
doesn't have to repeatedly calculate if the include_task should be
executed for steps 2-5 as well.

Backport note:
This is a re-implementation rather than a clean cherry-pick due to other
changes in this branch which make a clean cherry-pick impossible. The
contents of deploy-steps-tasks-step-1.yaml are a move of tasks from
deploy-steps-tasks.yaml as was done in the original patch. The rest of
the patch is the same.

Change-Id: Id5985ce8ac741baa9adc9f5874df0459fd4c24b2
'}]
commit_message:
Move common step 1 tasks to their own file

The large block of tasks in deploy-steps-tasks.yaml that are run only at
step 1, results in a large number of tasks being skipped at steps 2-5.
Task skipping is not "free", as ansible has to repeatedly compute what
needs to be skipped.

Note that the previous usage with the block statement causes the "when"
statement to be inherited to each task, so it has to be recalculated for
every task across every node for all steps.

The issue starts to become apparent with deployments with larger number
of nodes.

This commit refactors the steps 1 tasks into their own tasks file, and
then uses the include_task module to only include the tasks at step 1.

A separate play is also used for these step 1 tasks so that ansible
doesn't have to repeatedly calculate if the include_task should be
executed for steps 2-5 as well.

Backport note:
This is a re-implementation rather than a clean cherry-pick due to other
changes in this branch which make a clean cherry-pick impossible. The
contents of deploy-steps-tasks-step-1.yaml are a move of tasks from
deploy-steps-tasks.yaml as was done in the original patch. The rest of
the patch is the same.

Change-Id: Id5985ce8ac741baa9adc9f5874df0459fd4c24b2

commit_message:
Add deploy_steps_tasks to PER_TASK_STEPS

deploy_steps_tasks will now be written out in per step files in the
config download directory. This will allow including the task files for
a specific step only at that step, and saving time by not having to skip
so many tasks.

Change-Id: Id5fdb4dd1a6290d1097d2d81523161c87ab6d4dd
(cherry picked from commit 03fe9dfc3d5ae8952078891bc34e44a6d2426d20)
(cherry picked from commit cf5b602450a1cd0f48c86436b6632718470094d6)

subject: Fix performance regression due to reduced number of keystone workers
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2020-03-06 20:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-03-07 16:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nIMO this is a behavior change in a stable release that will cause a restart of keystone'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-09 14:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-10 15:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-06 20:20:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix performance regression due to reduced number of keystone workers

The puppet-keystone project consolidated keystone applications:

  https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/ace7aeb3b71b39a59f92fbc9e7f676a70c9a797a#diff-e5968f40345cf5d3be0539fbba87f787

This effectively reduces the number of available workers to process
keystone requests since only half the processes are deployed now that
the applications are consolidated [0]. As a result, we see a performance
regression [1] when interacting with keystone.

For example, in earlier versions, an 8 core machine would spawn four
processes to serve the keystone-main application. Another four processes
would be spawned to serve the keystone-admin application. Now, we only
have 4 processes total to serve the entire keystone application. Due to
the difference in the number of workers deployed by default, users will
experience reduced performance out-of-the-box.

This patch not only brings performance back to the previous levels, it
is also safe to implement as we are not changing the number of workers
when compared to previous releases and only bringing parity.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/master/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L33
[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1789495

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705041/
Change-Id: Icf9acaa106af705fa249a2ef2abca9f9a91fba59
(cherry picked from commit 8f5301d20d73a84cc10ea2591414e45cf3d1fa79)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix performance regression due to reduced number of keystone workers

The puppet-keystone project consolidated keystone applications:

  https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/ace7aeb3b71b39a59f92fbc9e7f676a70c9a797a#diff-e5968f40345cf5d3be0539fbba87f787

This effectively reduces the number of available workers to process
keystone requests since only half the processes are deployed now that
the applications are consolidated [0]. As a result, we see a performance
regression [1] when interacting with keystone.

For example, in earlier versions, an 8 core machine would spawn four
processes to serve the keystone-main application. Another four processes
would be spawned to serve the keystone-admin application. Now, we only
have 4 processes total to serve the entire keystone application. Due to
the difference in the number of workers deployed by default, users will
experience reduced performance out-of-the-box.

This patch not only brings performance back to the previous levels, it
is also safe to implement as we are not changing the number of workers
when compared to previous releases and only bringing parity.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/master/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L33
[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1789495

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705041/
Change-Id: Icf9acaa106af705fa249a2ef2abca9f9a91fba59
(cherry picked from commit 8f5301d20d73a84cc10ea2591414e45cf3d1fa79)

commit_message:
Ensure that ceph-ansible is installed in the undercloud.

This change impacts mostly to the upgrade from OSP14 to OSP15
in which we clean up all the openstack packages, however it's
also a nice check for the Undercloud upgrade. When making sure
we have the latest content on tht,tc,tripleoclient, etc... we
also ensure that ceph-ansible is installed if ceph is being
deployed.

Change-Id: I205425f31412c856e754539f67b039215a3b2189

commit_message:
Add object_server_mb_per_sync

The default mb_per_sync value of Swift leads to adding a lot of
latencies when transfering to an object store. This patch adds
the possibility to override this value for object store (it is
less relevant for other backend which rarely will reach the
cache size anyway). According to our tests, a value of 16 MB
is very good in production.

Change-Id: Id379d4221bc7e2a0c16125b97140e39b7726fd02

commit_message:
Remove support for ceph-ansible fetch directory

The state information in the ceph-ansible fetch directory
is no longer necessary to replace a Ceph monitor as of
ceph-ansible 4.0.14-1. Stein, Train, Ussuri and newer
should be using this version of ceph-ansible or newer.
TripleO does not need to do extra work to maintain the
fetch directory.

Add SwiftFetchDirGetTempurl, SwiftFetchDirPutTempurl, and
LocalCephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup to the deprecated list
of parameters and modify code to not use these parameters.
Remove call to tripleo-ansible/tripleo_ceph_fetch_dir role.

Update tripleo-common/workbooks/plan_management.yaml to not
create SwiftFetchDirGetTempurl and SwiftFetchDirPutTempurl
during deployment and update via depends-on patch.

Unlclean cherry pick; required manual changes.

Depends-On: I167449e4d7e38f0f5fd74251a3bd8f5b0b31451b
Change-Id: I3f8c2571a6dd35029d71dd42df637a962d9b3235
Closes-bug: #1863809
Closes-Bug: #1865357
(cherry picked from commit b656f523cfc4c486dd99fcb16d7d898e2603b913)
(cherry picked from commit 5ac7a8c49831b7b3b45b565c0be665605b919e2c)

subject: Delete stale fluent config on restart
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-10 12:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-10 13:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-10 15:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-10 12:59:55.000000000', 'message': 'Delete stale fluent config on restart

We already only include .conf files in fluent.conf:

(fluentd)[fluentd@cpu-e-1041 /etc/fluentd]$ cat fluent.conf
@include input/*.conf
@include filter/*.conf
@include format/*.conf
@include output/*.conf

so this change should not cause ill effect. This works because of the
merge option in config files:

merge: merges the source directory into the target directory instead of
replacing it. Boolean, defaults to false.

see https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/kolla_api.html#kolla-api-external-config

Change-Id: I28f63ec81f1ea5bc4a213d053bfb2c04388d5925
Closes-Bug: #1862211
(cherry picked from commit e7870e9df9e416b1b342ad6264bb66378fe62b3f)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete stale fluent config on restart

We already only include .conf files in fluent.conf:

(fluentd)[fluentd@cpu-e-1041 /etc/fluentd]$ cat fluent.conf
@include input/*.conf
@include filter/*.conf
@include format/*.conf
@include output/*.conf

so this change should not cause ill effect. This works because of the
merge option in config files:

merge: merges the source directory into the target directory instead of
replacing it. Boolean, defaults to false.

see https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/kolla_api.html#kolla-api-external-config

Change-Id: I28f63ec81f1ea5bc4a213d053bfb2c04388d5925
Closes-Bug: #1862211
(cherry picked from commit e7870e9df9e416b1b342ad6264bb66378fe62b3f)

commit_message:
Add press Ctrl-B for iPXE command line

Prior to embedding the iPXE script that does retries
the default would prompt the user to press Ctrl-B to
open the iPXE shell.

This change updates the embedded script to add the
Ctrl-B prompt.

Change-Id: Ic185cdceee50b38dea4f6815f1f2217b0586f365

commit_message:
Refactor redundant exception type checking

We can identify the exception class by 'except <ExceptionClass>'
so we don't need to check in inside except block.

Change-Id: Ib4f3a47b6f1121b1c753d06bd42e74c9a0762eac

commit_message:
Append the domain name to the host name in Nagios dashboard

This adds logic to check if an environment variable has been
set for the domain name and appends it to the host name
if it has so that the full FQDN appears in Nagios dashboard.
If the the domain name has not been set just the host name is
given like previous behavior.

Change-Id: Id42edb073d4701ddb61f4957af7e5ac5f931dfbf

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 15:37:09.000000000', 'message': "Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
(cherry picked from commit 9e80518b900a1f14a80ee05ddeef4b250433febd)
"}, {'created': '2020-02-28 02:04:37.000000000', 'message': "Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Note: This also removes the mocking of mistra_base, that was removed
from stable/rocky with 714d9eea4c871cfc979664cc8fc846cc02fba798.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
(cherry picked from commit 9e80518b900a1f14a80ee05ddeef4b250433febd)
"}, {'created': '2020-03-05 13:56:07.000000000', 'message': "Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

(cherry picked from commit 9e80518b900a1f14a80ee05ddeef4b250433febd)

commit_message:
Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Note: This also removes the mocking of mistra_base, that was removed
from stable/rocky with 714d9eea4c871cfc979664cc8fc846cc02fba798.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
(cherry picked from commit 9e80518b900a1f14a80ee05ddeef4b250433febd)

commit_message:
Add ceph dashboard frontend endpoint and tls-e integration

This change exposes to the end-user the new ceph dashboard
frontend which is fully integrated with grafana service.
This review also adds all the info/classes to integrate the
service with tls-everywhere framework, providing the cert
request and generation that will be passed to ceph dashboard
via ceph-ansible.

Depends-On: I7728b6a6bbf8447ec3290a13cb7f5807b30cc01f
Change-Id: Id6d2e4b00355cd84baccc2b493f3205c2b32a44b
(cherry picked from commit eec31fd149ee3e009a0a6b3a1b8f040c2e709c52)

I didn't use a for loop as the logic for omitting the
comma for the final element dirties the logic.

commit_message:
jq and -f json replace -f value in bmc script

The output format when using --format value has changed
with the recent version of openstacksdk. To fix this use
--format json instead and parse the json output using
jq

This is to workaround this bug(?) in openstacksdk.
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006659

Change-Id: Ie196ce1144eea76b8cb081c4cfe434c157510ae9

commit_message:
Enable train, disable rocky and certs fix

Fixes for masakari tests now that patches have landed.

* Add missing default handler for certificates to charm
* Remove rocky from tests until patch lands in packages
* Add train test
* Add release numbers for train and ussuri

Change-Id: Ie3ff9f454afdd9a7fd389fe007d9803884bc9906

commit_message:
Explicitly set --bindir when isntalling bundle

... so that we can make sure that bundle command is installed in
GEM_HOME/bin directory.

Change-Id: I1ea78bbd2b7fe22d510e10b0c96c0ed7bdc9f8a3
Closes-Bug: #1866176

commit_message:
[ceph-mon] update stop script not to remove mons from monmap

This is to update ceph-mon stop script  not to remove mons from
monmap as in multinode clusters three mons in the monmap are required
to handle the quorum properly.

Change-Id: I0dd643007ea0558244bfecae1d90db78828e9834

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 11:28:34.000000000', 'message': "Adapt FFWD2 Undercloud upgrade workflow.

In theory, in this FFWD iteration (Queens to Train) it won't
be needed to perform an Undercloud upgrade sequentially. Therefore
we don't need to build the same script to upgrade the undercloud
three times. Instead, we will make use of the very same script
used to upgrade the undercloud in updates and upgrades.

This patch also removes some unnecessary playbooks from the last
FFWD.

Change-Id: I975fc0c5bf25681bb944415eaccd3a0672998d01

commit_message:
Adapt FFWD2 Undercloud upgrade workflow.

In theory, in this FFWD iteration (Queens to Train) it won't
be needed to perform an Undercloud upgrade sequentially. Therefore
we don't need to build the same script to upgrade the undercloud
three times. Instead, we will make use of the very same script
used to upgrade the undercloud in updates and upgrades.

This patch also removes some unnecessary playbooks from the last
FFWD and splits the scripts creation into undercloud and overcloud
scripts creation plays and moves the configure_uc_containers.yaml
playbook into the common/ folder so it can be used by the
fast-forward-upgrade and upgrades workflows.

Change-Id: I975fc0c5bf25681bb944415eaccd3a0672998d01

commit_message:
Use a common playbook import for common plays

It would appear that we use many of the same plays in several
of the playbooks. In this patch we extract these into a common
playbook file so that we only need to repeat a single import
in each of the playbooks. This way we reduce the maintenance
burden because we only need to maintain it in one file.

Change-Id: Ib00e8aa9f7d06517290543a8aaf8a2527969bd3c

subject: Initital ffwd2 patch to automate OS upgrade.
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-03-05 20:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-03-09 13:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2020-03-10 11:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-05 20:50:52.000000000', 'message': 'Initital ffwd2 patch to automate OS upgrade.

This patch updates some of the ffu existing variables in
the tripleo-upgrade role to be able to upgrade to the
ffu (Queens to Train).

Also, it includes the undercloud operating system upgrade
logic as part of the upgrade of the undercloud (which will
be used mostly downstream). It leverages from the existing
play in common/undercloud_os_upgrade.yaml and adds the
specific tasks right before invoking it.

As part of the refactoring, the fast forward upgrades
automation tasks also make use of the imporved workarounds
mechanism, so all the operations (update,upgrade,ffwd)
share the same format for the workarounds.

Removing too the python-jsonpointer package before running
leapp upgrade on the undercloud node, as it is conflicting
after the upgrade and it does seem to not impact into the
leapp or subscription-manager packages dependencies.

Change-Id: I3b917434b9bc7d5d288b702e85a07b2356fa6896
(cherry picked from commit c6574d0271b4c7e24c38b2cccdf869bfa859affb)
'}]
commit_message:
Initital ffwd2 patch to automate OS upgrade.

This patch updates some of the ffu existing variables in
the tripleo-upgrade role to be able to upgrade to the
ffu (Queens to Train).

Also, it includes the undercloud operating system upgrade
logic as part of the upgrade of the undercloud (which will
be used mostly downstream). It leverages from the existing
play in common/undercloud_os_upgrade.yaml and adds the
specific tasks right before invoking it.

As part of the refactoring, the fast forward upgrades
automation tasks also make use of the imporved workarounds
mechanism, so all the operations (update,upgrade,ffwd)
share the same format for the workarounds.

Removing too the python-jsonpointer package before running
leapp upgrade on the undercloud node, as it is conflicting
after the upgrade and it does seem to not impact into the
leapp or subscription-manager packages dependencies.

Change-Id: I3b917434b9bc7d5d288b702e85a07b2356fa6896
(cherry picked from commit c6574d0271b4c7e24c38b2cccdf869bfa859affb)

3) Remove mentions of "root" from find_devices_by_hints, it's going

'}]
commit_message:
Improve device hints logging

1) Log which hints matches the final root device
2) Log each rejection for easier debugging
3) Remove mentions of "root" from find_devices_by_hints, it's going
   to be also used for RAID ddevices.

commit_message:
Increase randomness of generated CephFSID

Switch from uuid1() to uuid4() so that the resulting
UUID is more random because getnode() is not used.

Change-Id: I611efb6ef5b6e899e3223ecb698e331ed6326c3b
Closes-Bug: #1856762

commit_message:
Add `NovaMaxDiskDevicesToAttach` parameter

This change exposes the `[compute]/max_disk_devices_to_attach`
in Nova config. The paramerer sets maximum number of disk devices
allowed to attach to a single server.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/708666
Change-Id: I08c5769bfe5f38d2503ed232b3771f615c24d158

commit_message:
Update the tox minversion parameter.

Update the minversion parameter to use the python -m pip to install
python packages:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#id185

It's recommend to use this. Remove the useless install_command
parameter.

Change-Id: I17588a5702fa1f9429dd6bc2d1a8c4ad9e90c539

switch to advertising that name so that everything is consistent.

commit_message:
Use fqdn to refer to remote nodes

Now that nova-compute uses an fqdn to identify the hypervisor *1
switch to registering remote nodes using their fqdn to keep
everything consistent. This is a requirement for masakari host
monitoring.

*1 https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/commit/1869bfbc9711eac157821f8a4702409822c0842e

Change-Id: I6cd55fdf21482de908920bcc4d399ac03f903d58

commit_message:
Moving common objects under KeyManager.

Both Barbican and Vault backends have this replicated code. Let's
centralize it to reduce code duplication.

Change-Id: I365a6d3031695ee369664c00a61816c77792f2e2
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move keystone to run as a headless service

This change moves keystone to run as a headless service, this
is part of the movement for each openstack service.

Change-Id: I86cb902bcd17bf676160117a08824e5cb65616d2

commit_message:
Release neutron-lib 2.2.0

New changes:
 - rbac-address-scope api extension
 - rbac-subnetpool api extension
 - is_sort_key added to vpnaas attribute maps
 - move warnings of using old and new enginefacade to be debug logs

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-01-15 11:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to remove-python2'}, {'account_id': 2062, 'date': '2020-01-15 11:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2062, 'date': '2020-01-15 11:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hm, thinking about this again. Don't we need to set the Name attribute to "{{ py2name(py_versions='py3') }}" to get the correct package name?'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-01-15 14:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hm, thinking about this again. Don't we need to set the Name
 > attribute to "{{ py2name(py_versions='py3') }}" to get the correct
 > package name?

Not really. We only need this if we don't explicitly declare a python3-XXX subpackage, which is what I did in most reviews.

In this case, since there is no "%files" section for the main package ("python-sushy"), it will simply not be created. You can check [1] to see that the src.rpm is named python-sushy, but the built rpm is python3-sushy.


[1] - http://logs.rdoproject.org/76/702376/1/openstack-check-rdo/DLRN-rpmbuild-rpm-packaging-fedora/21dc5aa/buildset/fedora/repos/current/'}, {'account_id': 2062, 'date': '2020-01-16 08:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Ok then.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2020-01-16 09:16:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-03-10 13:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 3597647f5ff09ff00368e26a360451b0c7cc8586'}]

subject: Proposed release schedule for Victoria (22w)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-18 18:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-18 19:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

So... 22-week is definitely short. But not disturbingly short.

Historically most releases fell in the 25-28 week range. Shorter releases were Ocata (20 weeks) and Liberty (24 weeks). Longer were Stein (32 weeks) and Ussuri (30 weeks). Having 22-24 week cycles in Northern hemisphere summer and 30-32 week cycles in Northern hemisphere winter is still in the "OK" range in my book.

If this date makes it easier on the release team and Canonical, I'm +1'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2020-02-20 15:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Proposed release schedule for Victoria (22w)

This proposes a 22 week release schedule to align the release right
before the week of the fall Summit event.

Change-Id: I8c4aff8a600773640539db1f88fb0d7ef74024d7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add custom ansible-lint rule for Role Names

Roles can no longer have a "-" in them according to the upstream ansible
documentation[0]. This change adds a new ansible-lint rule to check if
the role name is respecting the Ansible recommendations.

This patch bumps python-novaclient lower constraints to 15.1.0.

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/dev_guide/developing_collections.html#roles-directory

Change-Id: I62bffc9ed3c0076f9a8415d00ed9b34911a7597f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 148199846dd5f58687793f41250da4cceca131c5)

commit_message:
Fix restart unit condition on radosgw

This change just fixes the restart condition
for the radosgw file used when the certificate
is renewed.

Change-Id: Id3f76cd03c993d013090c7c764d6963a64a1c74f

commit_message:
Add the certificate specs in ceph_mgr service

In order to meet the tls cert request requirements, this
change adds the tht config and metadata settings when
the ceph dashboard is enabled.

Change-Id: I888bb421eaa6b82ebac57a5420fc60fc4744840a
(cherry picked from commit e89178b7ba9d0412f2dd7a207c3b55b39d373e7c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 14:46:40.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Search Path Override

If you follow the docs for developing validations, you will find
you run into an error when attempting to execute your new validation
because the code is currently hard coded to search in a path in
/usr/share where the packaging installs the validations.  For
development, you must hack the path in the script to make this work.

This patch adds a simple override where a developer can export
a path to the VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR environment variable and that will
be used as the search path for validations.  Example:

cd tripleo-validations
export VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR=$(pwd)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/
Change-Id: I064c11561af67d284dcf1ab024e0d600e12a8f98
(cherry picked from commit 20c791f81507b65d06589b0659b0e899c50eef53)
'}, {'created': '2020-02-24 15:50:40.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Search Path Override

This patch adds a simple override where a developer can export

Change-Id: I064c11561af67d284dcf1ab024e0d600e12a8f98

commit_message:
Adds Search Path Override

If you follow the docs for developing validations, you will find
you run into an error when attempting to execute your new validation
because the code is currently hard coded to search in a path in
/usr/share where the packaging installs the validations.  For
development, you must hack the path in the script to make this work.

This patch adds a simple override where a developer can export
a path to the VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR environment variable and that will
be used as the search path for validations.  Example:

cd tripleo-validations
export VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR=$(pwd)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/
Change-Id: I064c11561af67d284dcf1ab024e0d600e12a8f98
(cherry picked from commit 20c791f81507b65d06589b0659b0e899c50eef53)

We already only include .conf files in fluent.conf:

(fluentd)[fluentd@cpu-e-1041 /etc/fluentd]$ cat fluent.conf
@include input/*.conf
@include filter/*.conf
@include format/*.conf
@include output/*.conf

so this change should not cause ill effect. This works because of the
merge option in config files:

merge: merges the source directory into the target directory instead of
replacing it. Boolean, defaults to false.

see https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/kolla_api.html#kolla-api-external-config

commit_message:
Delete stale fluent config on restart

We already only include .conf files in fluent.conf:

(fluentd)[fluentd@cpu-e-1041 /etc/fluentd]$ cat fluent.conf
@include input/*.conf
@include filter/*.conf
@include format/*.conf
@include output/*.conf

so this change should not cause ill effect. This works because of the
merge option in config files:

merge: merges the source directory into the target directory instead of
replacing it. Boolean, defaults to false.

see https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/kolla_api.html#kolla-api-external-config

Change-Id: I28f63ec81f1ea5bc4a213d053bfb2c04388d5925
Closes-Bug: #1862211

Thanks Julia, as I know ilike is a postgresql extension, the CI seems happy, so does this mean ilike has been supported by mysql? or just handled by sqlalchemy?'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-07 17:35:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > As far as I'm aware, the difference gets handled by sqlalchemy. On
 > mysql it passes LIKE for similar behavior.

Yes, looks like this ^ is indeed the case [1].

I also note that by default in mysql, text type comparisons are case-insensitive [2]. 

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/internals.html#sqlalchemy.orm.interfaces.PropComparator.ilike
[2] https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/case-sensitivity.html"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-09 20:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2020-03-06 20:28:17.000000000', 'message': "Make reservation checks caseless

If a conductor hostname is changed while reservations are
issued to a conductor with one hostname, such as 'hostName'
and then the process is restarted with 'hostname', then the
queries would not match the node and effectively the nodes
would become inaccessible until the reservation is cleared.

This patch changes the queries to use a case insenitive
like search, better known as ilike.

Change-Id: Ib7da925ba5ca6a82ba542e0f4ae4cf7f0d070835
"}, {'created': '2020-03-06 20:30:32.000000000', 'message': "Make reservation checks caseless

If a conductor hostname is changed while reservations are
issued to a conductor with one hostname, such as 'hostName'
and then the process is restarted with 'hostname', then the
queries would not match the node and effectively the nodes
would become inaccessible until the reservation is cleared.

This patch changes the queries to use a case insenitive
like search, better known as ilike.

Special thanks to the nova team for finding a bug in the hash
ring calculation in the ironic virt driver where a customer
changed their nova-compute hostname, which inspired this
patch.

Change-Id: Ib7da925ba5ca6a82ba542e0f4ae4cf7f0d070835
"}]
commit_message:
Make reservation checks caseless

If a conductor hostname is changed while reservations are
issued to a conductor with one hostname, such as 'hostName'
and then the process is restarted with 'hostname', then the
queries would not match the node and effectively the nodes
would become inaccessible until the reservation is cleared.

This patch changes the queries to use a case insenitive
like search, better known as ilike.

Special thanks to the nova team for finding a bug in the hash
ring calculation in the ironic virt driver where a customer
changed their nova-compute hostname, which inspired this
patch.

Change-Id: Ib7da925ba5ca6a82ba542e0f4ae4cf7f0d070835

subject: Fix Filebeat/Auditbeat conflict
messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-03-09 16:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2020-03-09 19:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-03-10 12:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-09 16:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Filebeat/Auditbeat conflict

The default Filebeat prospectors currently look for all log files in
/var/log/. This can cause conflicts with auditbeat, which also monitors
audit log files in /var/log and can fail to get a lock on the appropriate
log files, subsequently failing. This commit explicitly removes audit
log files from the Filebeat prospector path to remove this conflict.

Change-Id: I2146bd6f4980610f32d27896406167458e08dffe
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Filebeat/Auditbeat conflict

The default Filebeat prospectors currently look for all log files in
/var/log/. This can cause conflicts with auditbeat, which also monitors
audit log files in /var/log and can fail to get a lock on the appropriate
log files, subsequently failing. This commit explicitly removes audit
log files from the Filebeat prospector path to remove this conflict.

Change-Id: I2146bd6f4980610f32d27896406167458e08dffe

commit_message:
Ensure that default SG exists during list of SG rules API call

During processing of security group rule list API call Neutron will
now ensure that default security group for project given in the filters
or in the context exists.
It is similar to what is done for list of security groups or creation of
new network/port in the project.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py

Change-Id: Id6fee5a752968b356b884d939b708a420016c9bc
Closes-Bug: #1864171
(cherry picked from commit 4739a4febb8c77e5a0ca48bc77ae4dccd9f8a81e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-04 16:57:32.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Ignore DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

There was a previous attempt to fix this in
change Id687e11e235fd6c2f99bb647184310dfdce9a08d. However, there were 2
problems with the previous fix:

1. The handling of missing volumes and disks, while typically having the
   same cause, was inconsistent.

2. It failed to consider the very wide race opportunity in
   _get_disk_over_committed_size_total between initially fetching the
   instance list from the DB and later getting disk sizes.

Because _get_disk_over_committed_size_total() can be a very long
operation, we found that we were reliably hitting this race in CI.
It might be possible to fix the race, but this would add unnecessary
complication to code which isn't critical. It's far more robust just to
log it and ignore it, which is also consistent with the handling of
missing volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1774249

Change-Id: I48719c02713113a41176b8f5cc3c5831f1284a39
(cherry picked from commit 6198f317be549e6d2bd324a48f226b379556e945)
(cherry picked from commit 73d9b6e5f622dc645ac6ad322c836ffbe4045072)
(cherry picked from commit 4700b3658e5983a731d0da259365317e230c4a52)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

There was a previous attempt to fix this in
change Id687e11e235fd6c2f99bb647184310dfdce9a08d. However, there were 2
problems with the previous fix:

1. The handling of missing volumes and disks, while typically having the
   same cause, was inconsistent.

2. It failed to consider the very wide race opportunity in
   _get_disk_over_committed_size_total between initially fetching the
   instance list from the DB and later getting disk sizes.

Because _get_disk_over_committed_size_total() can be a very long
operation, we found that we were reliably hitting this race in CI.
It might be possible to fix the race, but this would add unnecessary
complication to code which isn't critical. It's far more robust just to
log it and ignore it, which is also consistent with the handling of
missing volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1774249

Change-Id: I48719c02713113a41176b8f5cc3c5831f1284a39
(cherry picked from commit 6198f317be549e6d2bd324a48f226b379556e945)
(cherry picked from commit 73d9b6e5f622dc645ac6ad322c836ffbe4045072)
(cherry picked from commit 4700b3658e5983a731d0da259365317e230c4a52)

In some envs the `instance_uuid` can be `None`, if this happens
we will override using `node_uuid`.

Story: #2007302
Task: #38779
(cherry picked from commit 09f802160ec6e62be0aa16d4078369e985394cd3)

commit_message:
Add notify restart container when cert changed

When change the cert file in /etc/kolla/certificate/.
The certificate in the container has not changed.
So I think can use kolla-ansible deploy when certificate is
changed. restart <container>

Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-cacerts

Change-Id: Iaac6f37e85ffdc0352e8062ae5049cc9a6b3db26
Signed-off-by: yj.bai <bai.yongjun@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
Log CNI_ARGS and CNI_NETNS in kuryr-cni

Currently we only print "Calling Kuryr Daemon." in our kuryr-cni plugin
binary. This isn't really helpful:

crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:49 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:53 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:53 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:53 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:54 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:54 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
crio[1963]: 2020/03/03 20:53:54 Calling Kuryr Daemon.
(…)

This commit enhances that logging to include values of CNI_ARGS and
CNI_NETNS, which should allow us to identify which request is being
handled.

Change-Id: Ie66e4972cc109990d0f4fc077fa9031ac67db7ff
Related-Bug: 1854928
