revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-18 10:55:55.000000000', 'message': 'Recalculate 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' on resize

When resizing, it's possible to change the NUMA topology of an instance,
or remove it entirely, due to different extra specs in the new flavor.
Unfortunately we cache the instance's NUMA topology object in
'RequestSpec.numa_topology' and don't update it when resizing. This
means if a given host doesn't have enough free CPUs or mempages of the
size requested by the *old* flavor, that host can be rejected by the
filter.

Correct this by regenerating the 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' field as
part of the resize operation, ensuring that we revert to the old field
value in the case of a resize-revert.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts are due to the absence of two changes:
change I329f0fd589a4b2e0426485f09f6782f94275cc07 ("nova-net: Remove
layer of indirection in 'nova.network'") and change
I7a4b951f3ab324c666ab924e6003d24cc8e539f5 ("Use
COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait during migrate"), neither of which
we want to or can backport.

Modifications:
	nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_servers.py

NOTE(stephenfin): The functional test is modified because the
'_create_server' helper function was added in change
I84c58de90dad6d86271767363aef90ddac0f1730 and is too invasive to
backport.

Change-Id: I0ca50665b86b9fdb4618192d4d6a3bcaa6ea2291
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Closes-bug: #1805767
(cherry picked from commit c29f382f69ed0bfe2c8782913e2a882344ff461f)

commit_message:
Recalculate 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' on resize

When resizing, it's possible to change the NUMA topology of an instance,
or remove it entirely, due to different extra specs in the new flavor.
Unfortunately we cache the instance's NUMA topology object in
'RequestSpec.numa_topology' and don't update it when resizing. This
means if a given host doesn't have enough free CPUs or mempages of the
size requested by the *old* flavor, that host can be rejected by the
filter.

Correct this by regenerating the 'RequestSpec.numa_topology' field as
part of the resize operation, ensuring that we revert to the old field
value in the case of a resize-revert.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts are due to the absence of two changes:
change I329f0fd589a4b2e0426485f09f6782f94275cc07 ("nova-net: Remove
layer of indirection in 'nova.network'") and change
I7a4b951f3ab324c666ab924e6003d24cc8e539f5 ("Use
COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait during migrate"), neither of which
we want to or can backport.

Modifications:
	nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_servers.py

NOTE(stephenfin): The functional test is modified because the
'_create_server' helper function was added in change
I84c58de90dad6d86271767363aef90ddac0f1730 and is too invasive to
backport.

Change-Id: I0ca50665b86b9fdb4618192d4d6a3bcaa6ea2291
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Closes-bug: #1805767
(cherry picked from commit c29f382f69ed0bfe2c8782913e2a882344ff461f)

commit_message:
Validate id as integer for os-aggregates

According to the api-ref, the id passed to calls in os-aggregates is
supposed to be an integer. No function validated this, so any value
passed to these functions would directly reach the DB. While this is
fine for SQLite, making a query with a string for an integer column on
other databases like PostgreSQL results in a DBError exception and thus
a HTTP 500 instead of 400 or 404.

This commit adds validation for the id parameter the same way it's
already done for other endpoints.

Closes-Bug: 1865040

Change-Id: I83817f7301680801beaee375825f02eda526eda1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-03 20:11:10.000000000', 'message': "Remove extra header fields in proxied metadata requests

If a user specifies a header in their request for metadata,
it could override what the proxy would have inserted on their
behalf. Make sure to remove any headers we don't want, and
override something that might be present in the request.
If the agent somehow gets a request with both headers it will
silently drop it.

Change-Id: Id6c103b7bcebe441c27c6049d349d84ba7fd15a6
Closes-bug: #1865036
(cherry picked from commit 5af046fd4e6387cdbf8bf65ea4c2039a4019b64b)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove extra header fields in proxied metadata requests

If a user specifies a header in their request for metadata,
it could override what the proxy would have inserted on their
behalf. Make sure to remove any headers we don't want, and
override something that might be present in the request.
If the agent somehow gets a request with both headers it will
silently drop it.

Change-Id: Id6c103b7bcebe441c27c6049d349d84ba7fd15a6
Closes-bug: #1865036
(cherry picked from commit 5af046fd4e6387cdbf8bf65ea4c2039a4019b64b)

commit_message:
trivial: Use 'from foo import bar'

In some tests, we were doing an import with a full module path. This has
the side effect of importing every submodule on that path, which led to
some confusing side effects. Use 'import foo from bar' syntax instead
and clean up the damage.

Change-Id: I91a289630f31674dec1d785d67b5acda173b7d7e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Disable trunk subports connectivity test on Rocky iptables_hybrid job

Recent Rocky backports fail
neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-openvswitch-iptables_hybrid-rocky job
and as mentioned in linked bug, this is expected as using trunks with
iptables-hybrid driver is not supported.

Add the test to the job blacklist

Change-Id: Iba083f66a4df8ecce23be07ec017d7dfc78406db
Related-Bug: #1838760

commit_message:
Migrate functional tests job to the zuul v3 syntax

It migrates neutron-vpnaas-dsvm-functional-sswan job to the native
Zuulv3 syntax and renames it to be "neutron-vpnaas-functional-sswan".

Change-Id: Ibe6ac8677ace52e08edb7e47f3365616a3e6b29a

Using tests as filters is deprecated and will be removed in Ansible
version 2.9 so this change changes "result|search" to "result is search"
as recommended in the warning message.

commit_message:
Do not use tests as filters

Using tests as filters is deprecated and will be removed in Ansible
version 2.9 so this change changes "result|search" to "result is search"
as recommended in the warning message.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711904/

Change-Id: I940f522f87a42e20ee594be897b1f6853cef13e4
(cherry picked from commit b072b6e3abc49474e943daad2fe8df6ab22ef5d7)

commit_message:
Move CentOS8 to standard Puppetfile and bump puppet-mysql

mariadb has been updated in RDO CentOS7 for Ussuri so we can bump
puppet-mysql and use the same Puppetfile for all cases, no more
exceptions for CentOS8 are needed.

Change-Id: I1c4204c5b9fb893a2209666894792938f72b7548

> Kendall, can you look at this on the foundation site?
 > 
 > I suggest we should move forward with this one for now...

We chatted about it on TC channel with fungi[1]. His idea is to get rid of 'Community Member' terminology to just 'Account'. 

Mentioning those text in contributor guide can be another new confusing place about those membership. May eb we can just add reference to legal page or wait till we fix the join page about 'Community Member' Terminology? 

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2020-03-06.log.html#t2020-03-06T15:28:5"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-03-06 15:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

thanks, this lgtm. Ref to legal page describing the Membership policy makes sure we are not duplicating the text, especially the legal terms. Update foundation account profile

Add section about eligibity to vote to link to the OpenStack web site,
this replaces some content from infra manual.

See also https://review.opendev.org/711532

commit_message:
Fix openstack-dev git namespace use

The openstack-dev git namespace does not exist, fix the wrong places.
devstack is now in openstack, and sandbox in opendev.

Change-Id: Ie034240f988f4ea94ad2b7dc356bc9d21cad2045

subject: [ceph-pool] set pg_num_min to each pool
messages:
[{'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-03-06 03:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2020-03-06 12:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29974, 'date': '2020-03-06 17:24:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This shouldn't happen with the autoscaler configured properly. Needs deeper investigation."}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-03-06 17:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2020-03-06 19:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Brian Wickersham <brian.wickersham@att.com>
'}, {'account_id': 18511, 'date': '2020-03-06 19:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2020-03-09 16:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-06 03:21:21.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-pool] set pg_num_min to each pool

This is to set pg_num_min to avoid the warning
"too few PGs per OSD" since autoscaler will adjust the pgs
depends on the usage of the pool and at the start of the cluster
usage could be less on each pool.

setting the pg_num_min will make sure autoscaler will  not  reduce the pgs
on pools whose target_size_ratio is not set.

ex:

  cluster:
    id:     6b06a896-5ee1-43e4-b973-e3aee0f6297d
    health: HEALTH_WARN
            too few PGs per OSD (9 < min 30)

Change-Id: I28e8a2b2aba51387a83091d05f12833599889b5b
'}]
commit_message:
[ceph-pool] set pg_num_min to each pool

This is to set pg_num_min to avoid the warning
"too few PGs per OSD" since autoscaler will adjust the pgs
depends on the usage of the pool and at the start of the cluster
usage could be less on each pool.

setting the pg_num_min will make sure autoscaler will  not  reduce the pgs
on pools whose target_size_ratio is not set.

ex:

  cluster:
    id:     6b06a896-5ee1-43e4-b973-e3aee0f6297d
    health: HEALTH_WARN
            too few PGs per OSD (9 < min 30)

Change-Id: I28e8a2b2aba51387a83091d05f12833599889b5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-06 20:21:54.000000000', 'message': 'Have doubled workers for keystone service

Since we have merged 2 keystone services(public and admin) into one,
we need to double keystone workers so that we have the same number of
workers, which is necessory to avoid performance degradation.

This patch introduced new facter, os_workers_keystone, which returns
2 x os_workers .

Change-Id: I737fb14739a69ac12c39c7faf6dd2be1f772daa6
(cherry picked from commit 74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586)
'}]
commit_message:
Have doubled workers for keystone service

Since we have merged 2 keystone services(public and admin) into one,
we need to double keystone workers so that we have the same number of
workers, which is necessory to avoid performance degradation.

This patch introduced new facter, os_workers_keystone, which returns
2 x os_workers .

Change-Id: I737fb14739a69ac12c39c7faf6dd2be1f772daa6
(cherry picked from commit 74e0f5a3170b09632ad4ede7e20d3ebeb4514586)

subject: Add "name" filter in "list" call when retrieving a single register
messages: [{'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-03-04 19:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-09 14:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-03-09 15:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nGood to see this feature backported.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-04 19:33:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add "name" filter in "list" call when retrieving a single register

Resource.find() function accepts both the ID or the name of a register.
First tries to retrieve the register by calling the server API using
the identifier given. By default, all OpenStack API will accept the ID
of the register (which is unique). If this call fails, the function
retrieves the list of all registers in the table.

This last call is very inefficient if the number of elements is high.
The bug description documents the time needed to retrieve a list of
1000 ports.

Instead of this, this patch uses the filtering options available in the
servers APIs. This filter will be applied in the database call and the
number of registers returned will be limited to only those ones
matching the "name" field.

In case the API doesn't support this filtering parameter, a
"InvalidResourceQuery" will be risen and the function will retrieve
again the list of registers in the database without filtering by "name".

Change-Id: I8bb6f46f66249aeae0649c8f6596f9269e3518a5
Related-Bug: #1779882
(cherry picked from commit 790fefbccdc6d8bc7d39ab11051776a17fdebaec)
'}]
commit_message:
Add "name" filter in "list" call when retrieving a single register

Resource.find() function accepts both the ID or the name of a register.
First tries to retrieve the register by calling the server API using
the identifier given. By default, all OpenStack API will accept the ID
of the register (which is unique). If this call fails, the function
retrieves the list of all registers in the table.

This last call is very inefficient if the number of elements is high.
The bug description documents the time needed to retrieve a list of
1000 ports.

Instead of this, this patch uses the filtering options available in the
servers APIs. This filter will be applied in the database call and the
number of registers returned will be limited to only those ones
matching the "name" field.

In case the API doesn't support this filtering parameter, a
"InvalidResourceQuery" will be risen and the function will retrieve
again the list of registers in the database without filtering by "name".

Change-Id: I8bb6f46f66249aeae0649c8f6596f9269e3518a5
Related-Bug: #1779882
(cherry picked from commit 790fefbccdc6d8bc7d39ab11051776a17fdebaec)

subject: [CEPH] update checkdns scripts to update ceph_mon config
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-07 18:53:41.000000000', 'message': '[CEPH] update checkdns scripts to update ceph_mon config

This to update ceph_mon config with ips even when dns is up.

 - Daemons like mons having issues to form quorum if we have hostname
   based url for mons so these scipts will ensure all daemons will have ips
   for ceph_mon config.

 - if there are any daemons starts when single mon is there will have only
   that mon ip in config so these scripts will update the config files when
   more mons added to the cluster.

Change-Id: I8a4111f2b14d2d4652a66070c5c896c77660ea61
'}]
commit_message:
[CEPH] update checkdns scripts to update ceph_mon config

This to update ceph_mon config with ips even when dns is up.

 - Daemons like mons having issues to form quorum if we have hostname
   based url for mons so these scipts will ensure all daemons will have ips
   for ceph_mon config.

 - if there are any daemons starts when single mon is there will have only
   that mon ip in config so these scripts will update the config files when
   more mons added to the cluster.

Change-Id: I8a4111f2b14d2d4652a66070c5c896c77660ea61

commit_message:
Revert "[CentOS-8] Install ansible 2.8"

Ansible-2.9 is removed from CentOS8 deps repo, so
ansible pin should not be needed now.

This reverts commit 1ebc36367ec6bc05a40d1afaa522287d45c83a6e.

Change-Id: Ida6b7ce5068d02591a6082e6b8981dfadb4fff06

[{'created': '2020-03-06 12:08:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mapping of KeystoneOpenIdcEnableOAuth

KeystoneOpenIdcEnableOAuth currently creates a hiera entry
"keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_oauth_enabled", however this doesn't
exist, it's "keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_enable_oauth"

Change-Id: I867e0bcbfc54d759be85cb572413ad46d139d668
(cherry picked from commit 71dd438149b2d96af0658f34678b2dba2d36bdf2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mapping of KeystoneOpenIdcEnableOAuth

KeystoneOpenIdcEnableOAuth currently creates a hiera entry
"keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_oauth_enabled", however this doesn't
exist, it's "keystone::federation::openidc::openidc_enable_oauth"

Change-Id: I867e0bcbfc54d759be85cb572413ad46d139d668
(cherry picked from commit 71dd438149b2d96af0658f34678b2dba2d36bdf2)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27954, 'name': 'Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros', 'email': 'guimaraes@pm.me', 'username': 'moguimar'}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}, {'_account_id': 29222, 'name': 'Natal Ngétal', 'email': 'hobbestigrou@erakis.eu', 'username': 'hobbestigrou'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-29 15:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-07-10 06:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I rebased this against master to remove the merge conflict, but it relies on work in other patches with the same topic so it is not ready to merge yet.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Nice.  Want to see the output once the driver branch has landed, but this lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-12-06 20:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-07 17:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-07 17:15:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Whoops, didn't mean to vote."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-22 18:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-01-24 22:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Moisés Guimarães <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

There is already a more complete documentation generated by this file:

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/doc/source/reference/drivers.rst

It can be seen at this page:

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/reference/drivers.html

The documentation output of the code in this patch can be checked bellow for comparison with the documentation output we already have. While this patch automatically cover new drivers it only generates docs for the drivers class while the entire module has a lot more documentation to be exposed.

My suggestion is that this patch should be abandoned as it looks like duplicate of something we already have.

---

Configuration Source Drivers

In addition to command line options and configuration files, oslo.config can access configuration settings in other locations using drivers to define new sources.

remote_file

A backend driver for remote files served through http[s].

Required options:

        uri: URI containing the file location.

Non-required options:

        ca_path: The path to a CA_BUNDLE file or directory with
            certificates of trusted CAs.

        client_cert: Client side certificate, as a single file path
            containing either the certificate only or the private key and the certificate.

        client_key: Client side private key, in case client_cert is
            specified but does not includes the private key.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by Moisés Guimarães <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Reconsidering this patch for User Guide purposes.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-23 15:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-12-09 18:05:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

WIP because merge conflict

The thing about https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/doc/source/reference/drivers.rst is that it's a manually curated list of drivers. This patch uses stevedore to automate that. Also, this doesn't handle any drivers from other repos, whereas stevedore should pick up any drivers installed in the build environment, which may be helpful for stuff like the castellan driver. For out-of-tree drivers we know about we could just add them to the doc requirements and have them documented right in oslo.config."}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-12-10 10:33:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the insights, Ben. I'll take a new look at this patch when I'm back in January."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 17:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 17:12:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Fixed the merge conflict. I'll admit this doesn't offer a whole lot over what 'reference/drivers' does, but it's also no harm so WFM"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-12-17 17:51:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

+1 by waiting for the Moisés's January review"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-01-02 17:23:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If we decide to replace the manually curated version, we should add an entrypoint for the environment driver so it gets documented. Currently it's missing from the stevedore list."}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2020-01-21 13:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-07 19:39:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks good. I don't know the details, but Ben's comment sounds like something we may want to address here or in a follow up before merging this. Will leave it to someone else that knows more about the situation to approve."}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-03-09 16:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Force cast bridge mappings as an array

In some cases, the parameter will not passed as an array but as a
string, causing conversion error when generating the matching list

Force array parameter conversion to cover all cases

Change-Id: I4290bb1dbb96ea0d57e6ad8c6a686c2bf103c907
Closes-Bug: #1866206

commit_message:
Add retired and retired_reason fields to baremetal node

Recently ironic added the retired and retired_reason fields to
the node definition.
Adding them here as base to support marking nodes for
retirement.

Change-Id: I2a80c7653a3e55c89f892d0a90d8c40ea80a482b

[{'created': '2020-03-09 10:53:05.000000000', 'message': "Reflect openstacklib options for apache::vhost resources

It was discovered that Directory Index was enabled by default, leading
to potential leak of data.

A patch was done in puppet-openstacklib[1], but horizon doesn't use this
common lib, meaning it wasn't properly fixed.

[1] change id Icba53f4e32237556608f4cb6dcd9da1a71705c19

Related-Bug: #1854442
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1729423

Change-Id: Ife921f8409f58b70c5da4c344e330eec56669e20
(cherry picked from commit 7ec0c090ebdce9f48dbfa073c9427761c1a5ef11)
(cherry picked from commit bacf1cb9e5b8c914b1dc5826b4b9b4f749a13160)
"}]
commit_message:
Reflect openstacklib options for apache::vhost resources

It was discovered that Directory Index was enabled by default, leading
to potential leak of data.

A patch was done in puppet-openstacklib[1], but horizon doesn't use this
common lib, meaning it wasn't properly fixed.

[1] change id Icba53f4e32237556608f4cb6dcd9da1a71705c19

Related-Bug: #1854442
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1729423

Change-Id: Ife921f8409f58b70c5da4c344e330eec56669e20
(cherry picked from commit 7ec0c090ebdce9f48dbfa073c9427761c1a5ef11)
(cherry picked from commit bacf1cb9e5b8c914b1dc5826b4b9b4f749a13160)

commit_message:
Explicitely set ansible version to use

Remove the outdated ansible-pip-str.py and rely directly on
ANSIBLE_PIP_VERSION to set the installed version of ansible.

Change-Id: I105b85595cfea101bdb747113721536f4a3ef93a

commit_message:
Expose allocation owner to additional policy checks

Add is_allocation_owner to policy, giving Ironic admins
the option of modifying the policy file to allow users
specified by an allocation's owner field to perform API actions
on that allocation.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-14 19:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'Set up the initial displayed values in all boot-sources

Problem description
===================

In the launch instance workflow while creating a virtual machine,  when
I select the Source tab, most of the time the default boot-source is
`Image` and everything works just fine. However, some times, the default
boot-source comes as Volume, due to some race condition (tested and
reproduced in Chrome 77). In this case, the Available items table is
empty, even if there are bootable volumes to be attached to the VM. This
problem happens because the initial state of boot-sources is setting
only the `displayedAvailable` of the Image source (that is the "default
source"), instead of setting all the initial `displayedAvailable`
elements.

Proposal
========

The proposal is basically to set up the `displayedAvailable` in
all boot-sources.

Change-Id: I1c9399bf3f6c859206c093452c2e637892aa9722

commit_message:
Set up the initial displayed values in all boot-sources

Problem description
===================

In the launch instance workflow while creating a virtual machine,  when
I select the Source tab, most of the time the default boot-source is
`Image` and everything works just fine. However, some times, the default
boot-source comes as Volume, due to some race condition (tested and
reproduced in Chrome 77). In this case, the Available items table is
empty, even if there are bootable volumes to be attached to the VM. This
problem happens because the initial state of boot-sources is setting
only the `displayedAvailable` of the Image source (that is the "default
source"), instead of setting all the initial `displayedAvailable`
elements.

Proposal
========

The proposal is basically to set up the `displayedAvailable` in
all boot-sources.

Closes-Bug: #1848334

Change-Id: I1c9399bf3f6c859206c093452c2e637892aa9722

commit_message:
Don't DEBUG log django.template by default

It's sprinkled with exception handling, making the logs rather
unreadable.

Change-Id: Ifb42af60b4a08a6b06d52197d12a961aaf13bc84
Related-Bug: #1720893

commit_message:
Use a jinja block to reduce str_replace repetition

It would appear that we use the same str_replace params most
of the time, and there's no harm in using aliases where only
some of them are used. This way we reduce the maintenance
burden because we only need to maintain it in one place.

Change-Id: Ib034405a15ade9e9fb234a9875ebbe922abfdfc6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 11:07:43.000000000', 'message': '[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
'}, {'created': '2020-02-24 17:51:29.000000000', 'message': '[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
'}]
commit_message:
[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c

Looks like it's failing on virtualbmc. There was a new release last week which could be the problem."}, {'account_id': 15362, 'date': '2020-03-09 09:52:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Looks like it's failing on virtualbmc. There was a new release last
 > week which could be the problem.

Check job worked fine when I uploaded this change on Saturday and when I compare the logs of that run against this one, I see it complains about few missing files.

Log of successful run on Saturday: https://bfb5eff6c274dcb9d46d-fe98a86d691c6300a22f04f47f232829.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/711815/1/check/bifrost-integration-tinyipa-ubuntu-bionic/8896366/job-output.txt
Log of this run: https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_1fc/711815/1/check/bifrost-integration-tinyipa-ubuntu-bionic/1fc2fa3/job-output.txt

Here is the snippet where it fails but I don't see any change in Bifrost repo since Friday so I am not sure what's wrong...


2020-03-09 09:18:04.132576 | ubuntu-bionic | + cp '/httpboot/ipxe.*' /home/zuul/logs/pxe/
2020-03-09 09:18:04.134157 | ubuntu-bionic | cp: cannot stat '/httpboot/ipxe.*': No such file or directory
2020-03-09 09:18:04.134430 | ubuntu-bionic | + cp -aL /httpboot/pxelinux.cfg/ /home/zuul/logs/pxe/
2020-03-09 09:18:04.135822 | ubuntu-bionic | cp: cannot stat '/httpboot/pxelinux.cfg/': No such file or directory
2020-03-09 09:18:04.136075 | ubuntu-bionic | + source /home/zuul/openrc bifrost
2020-03-09 09:18:04.136198 | ubuntu-bionic | /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/scripts/collect-test-info.sh: line 78: /home/zuul/openrc: No such file or directory
2020-03-09 09:18:04.136671 | ubuntu-bionic | ++ openstack baremetal node list -c Name -f value
2020-03-09 09:18:04.136841 | ubuntu-bionic | /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/scripts/collect-test-info.sh: line 79: openstack: command not found"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-09 10:02:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 >

If you scroll up from there you can see the error about virtualbmc. That error is in the log gathering step after the main job."}, {'account_id': 15362, 'date': '2020-03-09 11:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

now I see it. Thanks for pointing that.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711904/

commit_message:
Do not use tests as filters

Using tests as filters is deprecated and will be removed in Ansible
version 2.9 so this change changes "result|search" to "result is search"
as recommended in the warning message.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711904/

Change-Id: I940f522f87a42e20ee594be897b1f6853cef13e4

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-04 01:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-04 01:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-04 01:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-04 01:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-04 21:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-03-05 10:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

Is there anything preventing us from putting this module into metalsmith like right now? As a bonus, we'll get immediate CI coverage."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-05 21:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Developing these modules in one series has been productive while the inter-module interface settles down, but I think that is done now.

metalsmith would need some ansible specific requirements, so a decision will need to be made whether to just add ansible to requirements.txt or to create a second requirements file. Also an ansible specific test harness would be needed to run test_metalsmith_instances. I can start this work if you can describe your preference on how to handle ansible dependencies.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2020-03-05 21:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21: Patch Set 20 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-06 15:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Patch Set 21 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-03-06 15:14:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-06 21:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-03-09 15:31:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

> metalsmith would need some ansible specific requirements, so a decision will need to be made whether to just add ansible to requirements.txt or to create a second requirements file

I'm quite against adding ansible to the main requirements file, some consumers may not need it. Let's have a separate file.

Also note that we have ~ 3 weeks before the non-client libraries freeze in Ussuri."}]

commit_message:
module metalsmith_instances

A module which performs reservation, provision and unprovision of a
multiple ironic node instances. The only package it imports is
metalsmith, to allow for the possible future option of putting it in
the metalsmith repo.

Change-Id: Ib6c7739d27c0fb5d937ce31c82c5c0bba86b5f41
Story: 2007212
Task: 38457

commit_message:
Change the default for octavia-worker workers to os_workers

Previously this was set to os_service_default but should use the
os_workers fact

Change-Id: Id26f6c1c252121f543938305098d22f6510299e5

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d
"}, {'created': '2020-01-23 14:43:14.000000000', 'message': "Make CentOS 8 tinyipa job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks to make CentOS 8 tinyipa
job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- kvm_stats util has been moved to kernel-tools, the package
qemu-kvm-tools doesn't exist anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d
"}, {'created': '2020-01-23 17:08:21.000000000', 'message': "Make CentOS 8 tinyipa job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks to make CentOS 8 tinyipa
job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- kvm_stats util has been moved to kernel-tools, the package
qemu-kvm-tools doesn't exist anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed
- qemu-system-x86 doesn't exist anymore, therefore we run
/usr/libexec/qemu-kvm instead of /bin/qemu-system-x86_64

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d
"}, {'created': '2020-01-24 09:54:08.000000000', 'message': "Make CentOS 8 tinyipa job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks to make CentOS 8 tinyipa
job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- kvm_stats util has been moved to kernel-tools, the package
qemu-kvm-tools doesn't exist anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed
- qemu-system-x86 doesn't exist anymore, therefore we run
/usr/libexec/qemu-kvm instead of /bin/qemu-system-x86_64
- change python2 packages to equal python3 when possible

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d
"}, {'created': '2020-01-24 13:57:28.000000000', 'message': "Make CentOS 8 tinyipa job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks to make CentOS 8 tinyipa
job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- kvm_stats util has been moved to kernel-tools, the package
qemu-kvm-tools doesn't exist anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed
- qemu-system-x86 doesn't exist anymore, therefore we run
/usr/libexec/qemu-kvm instead of /bin/qemu-system-x86_64
- change python2 packages to equal python3 when possible
- ipxe binary has changed to ipxe-x86_64.efi

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d
"}, {'created': '2020-01-24 14:43:11.000000000', 'message': "Make CentOS 8 tinyipa job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks to make CentOS 8 tinyipa
job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- kvm_stats util has been moved to kernel-tools, the package
qemu-kvm-tools doesn't exist anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed
- qemu-system-x86 doesn't exist anymore, therefore we run
/usr/libexec/qemu-kvm instead of /bin/qemu-system-x86_64
- change python2 packages to equal python3 when possible
- ipxe binary has changed to ipxe-x86_64.efi
- qemu machine type pc-1.0 is outdated, change it to q35

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d

commit_message:
Prepare to switch CentOS 8 job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks in preparation of
making CentOS 8 tinyipa job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed
- change python2 packages to equal python3 when possible
- ipxe binary has changed to ipxe-x86_64.efi

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d

commit_message:
Ignore Not Found when deleting Keystone role assignment

If the project has already been deleted, don't let that prevent role
assignments on it from being deleted.

Change-Id: I56aede8209e425ee6c2d762a44db8cda5416e69b
Task: 30955
(cherry picked from commit 8c67437378ca505c5752cee0d862d806ca11c3a0)

commit_message:
Run vbmcd as a Systemd service

Virtualbmc 2.0 dropped the daemon autostart feature. This means we need
to explicitly start it. Running it as a Systemd unit, code adapted from
Tenks.

In order to allow Systemd to execute the daemon on systems with SELinux
enabled, it must be installed to the system rather than a virtualenv.

Change-Id: I66e8e5f5a9c16ac90e132074c826d508458ae4d1

commit_message:
[monasca] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Iaba89b552b7d7490c7ee545f5ef6cf13a659dc4a

commit_message:
Add Certmonger ceph_rgw class to config tls

This patch adds the ceph_rgw class required by certmonger to
create the cert/key.
This patch also creates the service_pem file since the rgw
container private key, public certificate and any other CA or
intermediate certificates should be in one file, in PEM format.

Change-Id: I960f7c48866ef11e58e63d80217f7df660455fe1

commit_message:
[ironic] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I9520c1504bb944718070ef4124a95f38352920e6

commit_message:
[designate] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: If893e5c22d8c2f2f86ca6a472e74b457205ee2d8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Trigger ceph-ansible on ceph_systemd tag too

During fast forward upgrade we need a special step to migrate the
ceph systemd units to use podman, via ceph-ansible playbook.

This is triggered using --tags ceph_systemd so we want the ceph
tasks to run on that tag too.

Change-Id: I029903904550e789da731d83427bbcb7c6841c89
Closes-Bug: 1866339

commit_message:
Make sure -em tag is on last release

We don't want to allow tagging EM if there were no releases. We also
want to make sure the -em tag is on the last official release that was
done.

Change-Id: I7afb3a52cf2ec47d8e0154b51825b500806aa590
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add "closed" release cycles

Newton is EOL, and Ocata through Pike are in Extended Maintenance,
meaning they are closed as far as release management goes. This adds
those series to the list of closed cycles.

Change-Id: I3f3c3d61f40c951388f3a56e93bd23edd75f3276
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-atttach-inerfaces policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-attach-interfaces API policies.
- GET rules are made granular and default to System or project reader
- Other policies are default to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic405544560ae75ad88c10b8ff6d5048b3728cd2b

commit_message:
hyper-v: update support matrix

This change documents certain hyper-v driver features that are not
included in the driver support matrix.

Change-Id: I29f6d816138bd31ad6bc8d327636b202d718bdff

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 15:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure source service is up before resizing/migrating

If the source compute service is down when a resize or
cold migrate is initiated the prep_resize cast from the
selected destination compute service to the source will
fail/hang. The API can validate the source compute service
is up or fail the operation with a 409 response if the
source service is down. Note that a host status of
"MAINTENANCE" means the service is up but disabled by
an administrator which is OK for resize/cold migrate.

The solution here works the validation into the
check_instance_host decorator which surprisingly isn't
used in more places where the source host is involved
like reboot, rebuild, snapshot, etc. This change just
handles the resize method but is done in such a way that
the check_instance_host decorator could be applied to
those other methods and perform the is-up check as well.
The decorator is made backward compatible by default.

Note that Instance._save_services is added because during
resize the Instance is updated and the services field
is set but not actually changed, but Instance.save()
handles object fields differently so we need to implement
the no-op _save_services method to avoid a failure.

Conflicts:
    nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py
    nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py
    nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts as I8c96b337f32148f8f5899c9b87af331b1fa41424,
I711e56bcb4b72605253fa63be230a68e03e45b84 and
I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2 are not in stable/train.

Change-Id: I85423c7bcacff3bc465c22686d0675529d211b59
Closes-Bug: #1856925
(cherry picked from commit ea2ea492a3d046d53d44039206fff69fe7e3ac61)

commit_message:
Ensure source service is up before resizing/migrating

If the source compute service is down when a resize or
cold migrate is initiated the prep_resize cast from the
selected destination compute service to the source will
fail/hang. The API can validate the source compute service
is up or fail the operation with a 409 response if the
source service is down. Note that a host status of
"MAINTENANCE" means the service is up but disabled by
an administrator which is OK for resize/cold migrate.

The solution here works the validation into the
check_instance_host decorator which surprisingly isn't
used in more places where the source host is involved
like reboot, rebuild, snapshot, etc. This change just
handles the resize method but is done in such a way that
the check_instance_host decorator could be applied to
those other methods and perform the is-up check as well.
The decorator is made backward compatible by default.

Note that Instance._save_services is added because during
resize the Instance is updated and the services field
is set but not actually changed, but Instance.save()
handles object fields differently so we need to implement
the no-op _save_services method to avoid a failure.

Conflicts:
    nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py
    nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py
    nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts as I8c96b337f32148f8f5899c9b87af331b1fa41424,
I711e56bcb4b72605253fa63be230a68e03e45b84,
I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2 and
I19db48bd03855d1a1edbeff5adf15a28abcb5d92 are not in stable/train.

Change-Id: I85423c7bcacff3bc465c22686d0675529d211b59
Closes-Bug: #1856925
(cherry picked from commit ea2ea492a3d046d53d44039206fff69fe7e3ac61)

commit_message:
Fix os-keypairs pagination links

The API URL is '/os-keypairs', not '/keypairs'. Attempting to use these
pagination links as-is will result in a HTTP 404 (Not Found).

Change-Id: Ic04568caecc138e6016418f6878d031c4a0d3fb4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1866373

Hypervisor view builder's _collection_name,
'hypervisors' is used to build next link that
sdk use as uri to do paginated query. But correct
API should be `GET /v2.1/os-hypervisors?<params>`
rather than `GET /v2.1/hypervisors?<params>`.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idc4f3fe54136a6bd3dbc7dc0efd3f62745991199
Closes-Bug: 1864428
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix hypervisors paginted collection_name.

Hypervisor view builder's _collection_name,
'hypervisors' is used to build next link that
sdk use as uri to do paginated query. But correct
API should be `GET /v2.1/os-hypervisors?<params>`
rather than `GET /v2.1/hypervisors?<params>`.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idc4f3fe54136a6bd3dbc7dc0efd3f62745991199
Closes-Bug: 1864428
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>

commit_message:
zun: load container driver from entry point

Starting from U release, container driver is loaded from entry point.
Deployers should specify the entry point (i.e. ``docker``) in config
option ``container_driver`` under ``[DEFAULT]`` session.

Zun patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703259/

Change-Id: I96e38760e7b13a6e11737372e9e7fd36cca6f749

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 15:57:50.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Only validate token_flush for non-persistent tokens

THT incorporated a change so that the keystone_cron container deploys
only if a non-persistent token format is used:

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682265/

This is because `fernet` and `jws` tokens are completely non-persistent
by way of authenticated encryption and the keystone_cron container only
runs a cron job to execute `keystone-manage token_flush`, which prunes
expired tokens from keystone's token table. This cron job is useful for
deployments relying on `uuid`, `pki`, or some other out-of-tree provider
that requires tokens to be recorded for keystone's token validation
process.

This commit updates the validation to check for the token format and
only performs the validation if the token format isn't `fernet` or
`jws`.

Change-Id: Ib4d0a505021568975b79400d67fd709dd74e9acf

commit_message:
Don't validate token_flush for non-persistent token formats

THT incorporated a change so that the keystone_cron container deploys
only if a persistent token format is used (e.g, `uuid`, `pki`):

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682265/

This is because `fernet` and `jws` tokens are completely non-persistent
by way of authenticated encryption and the keystone_cron container only
runs a cron job to execute `keystone-manage token_flush`, which prunes
expired tokens from keystone's token table. This cron job is useful for
deployments relying on `uuid`, `pki`, or some other out-of-tree provider
that requires tokens to be recorded for keystone's token validation
process.

This commit updates the validation to check for the token format and
only performs the validation if the token format isn't `fernet` or
`jws`.

Change-Id: Ib4d0a505021568975b79400d67fd709dd74e9acf

'}]
commit_message:
Fix uwsgi groupname usage

There was an error where uwsgi services were launched
always with groupname = username, even when another
group was provided in uwsgi_services or set via
uwsgi_system_group_name.

Change-Id: Ifb4b026145849eb2c642d4c558d11f167548341e

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-deferred_delete policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-deferred_delete API policies.
This policy is default to PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I66f49e0ae7efaad791e6cd3194a959aed6945689

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-12 21:38:57.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in os-deferred_delete

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-deferred_delete API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I374876991c375d4765411204986e8fc2b0e08122

- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-deferred_delete API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-deferred_delete

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-deferred_delete API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I374876991c375d4765411204986e8fc2b0e08122

Change gz archive threshold

Update the default archive threshold in order to match official
recommendations:

https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/third_party.html

Change-Id: I4f6dfc22f51d2cd5aa2aa037303c734e31c21538
